text: U.K. GROWING IMPATIENT WITH JAPAN - THATCHER Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher said the U.K. Was growing more impatient with Japanese trade barriers and warned that it would soon have new powers against countries not offering reciprocal access to their markets.

CANADA OIL EXPORTS RISE 20 PCT IN 1986 Canadian oil exports rose 20 pct in 1986 over the previous year to 33.96 mln cubic meters, while oil imports soared 25.2 pct to 20.58 mln cubic meters, Statistics Canada said. Production, meanwhile, was unchanged from the previous year at 91.09 mln cubic feet.

COFFEE, SUGAR AND COCOA EXCHANGE NAMES CHAIRMAN The New York Coffee, Sugar and Cocoa Exchange (CSCE) elected former first vice chairman Gerald Clancy to a two-year term as chairman of the board of managers, replacing previous chairman Howard Katz. Katz, chairman since 1985, will remain a board member.
